title: Read a File
code:
with open('file.txt', 'r') as file:  # open for reading file.txt
    contents = file.read()  # store file's content in a variable
    print(contents)  # Python is cool!
explanation: Opens a text file safely using a built-in context manager in read-only mode ('r' flag), reads its entire content, and prints it. Using 'with' ensures the file is closed automatically so that it can be accessed by other processes.
